Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 1-3: Temp: 20-21 Low Ambient Pressure: 1 Low Vibration: 0 None Flow: 0 Tool Pos: 0 Energy: 0.40-0.50 Low Idle Interpretation: Machine is on but not doing anything active. Likely Idle Startup

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 4-6: Temp: 50 58 Rising significantly. Pressure: 1 1.5 Slight increase. Vibration: 30 38 High. Flow: 5 Consistent. Tool Pos: 5 10 Moving. Energy: 2.0 3.0 High usage. Interpretation: High vibration high energy rising temp material flow. This looks like Cutting Metal

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Events 7-8: Temp: 40 Dropping from previous high. Pressure: 2 Peaked. Vibration: 10 Lower than cutting. Flow: 2 Lower than cutting. Tool Pos: 15 Holding position. Energy: 2.00 Moderate. Interpretation: The vibration drops pressure rises slightly tool holds position. This feels like a transitional phase or Assembling Parts Or Quality Inspection Lets reserve judgment

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 9: Temp: 80 Very High. Pressure: 2. Vibration: 50 Highest. Flow: 0 No material flow. Tool Pos: 15 Static. Energy: 5.0 Highest. Interpretation: Extreme heat high vibration high energy zero flow. Welding

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 11-12: Temp: 25 Ambient. Pressure: 1. Vibration: 5 Low. Flow: 1 Material moving again. Tool Pos: 20 End position. Energy: 1.5 1.6. Interpretation: Material is flowing again output tool moves to final position. Packaging

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Refining the Labels: Lets re-evaluate Events 7-8. mapping: 1-3: Idle Startup 4-6: Cutting Metal 7-8: Assembling Parts 9: Welding 10: Quality Inspection 11-12: Packaging 13-15: Idle End of Cycle

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Alternative interpretation for 7-8: Could 7-8 be Quality Inspection If 4-6 is Cutting. Then 7-8: Temp drops Vib drops. Inspection Then 9: Welding You usually inspect after welding. So 7-8 being Assembling makes more sense chronologically. Cut Assemble Weld Inspect Package

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Lets double check the values for Assembling vs Cutting. Cutting 4-6: Temp: 50-58 Vib: 30-38 Flow: 5 Pressure: 1-1.5 Assembling 7-8: Temp: 40 Vib: 10 Flow: 2 Pressure: 2 Lower vibration Higher Pressure Lower Temp Material Flow drops

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Final check of the narrative: The machine wakes up Idle. It cuts raw material Cutting. It puts parts together Assembling indicated by pressure clamping. It fuses them Welding indicated by heat. It checks the work Inspection indicated by inactivity stabilization. It packs the result Packaging indicated by flow and movement. This is a very logical manufacturing sequence
